definition: medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
leaf of the iris/variant of 藥|药[yao4]

sentences.english: Regret to buy, mouse medicine more.
sentences.chinese: 后悔药买不到，老鼠药多的是。

sentences.english: Objective To explore the effect and methods of nursing care of children with toxin of kill-rat medicine treated by hemodialysis.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨鼠药中毒血液透析的疗效和护理经验。

sentences.english: I took a bottle of liquid medicine to kill the rat.
Rat poison has been laid at all of them.
sentences.chinese: 所有地方都已放置老鼠药。

sentences.english: Put rat poison in the coffee, and a little ground glass.
sentences.chinese: 把老鼠药放进咖啡里好了，再来点玻璃粉。

sentences.english: Turns out that funny smell was rat poison.
sentences.chinese: 原来那奇怪的气味是老鼠药。

sentences.english: We left rat poison near the hole where we saw mice.
sentences.chinese: 我们在老鼠出没的洞口处放了老鼠药。

sentences.english: Flower beds receive attention from a pest control worker.
sentences.chinese: 防治虫鼠人员在花槽放置鼠药，杜绝鼠患。

sentences.english: We can trap the mice by putting candies in the rat-bane.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以把糖果放进灭鼠药里，以此诱捕老鼠。

sentences.english: HP is a safe and effective treatment for severe children with acute poisoning.
sentences.chinese: HP为治疗灭鼠药中毒危重患儿的有效手段。

sentences.english: I took a bottle of liquid medicine.

definition: dichlorvos C4H7Cl2PO4, organic phosphate used as insecticide (loanword)/also called dimethyl dichloro-vinyl phosphate DDVP
trichlorphon C4H8Cl3PO4, organic phosphate used as insecticide/also called dipterex
